intro: Androsace brahmaputrae, commonly known as the Brahmaputra sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in early summer. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to the cold and arid conditions of its habitat. Androsace brahmaputrae is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
